name: Seldon
description:
Organisations are looking towards machine learning to help them build a one-to-one relationship with customers and make better decisions. But data scientists are in short supply, and developing machine learning in-house is expensive and time-consuming.

Seldon is the open-source machine learning platform for enterprise-grade recommendations and predictive analytics. Its end-to-end solution includes proven algorithms, industry models, and a pluggable microservices architecture. Seldon is platform-agnostic with no vendor lock-in. You keep full ownership and control of your data on-premise or in the cloud.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Alex Housley
team.bioHtml: Founder & CEO of Seldon - machine learning deployment platform. Helping people predict and shape the future. Barclays Techstars '16.

team.title: Commercial Lead
team.name: Lee Baker
team.bioHtml: Seldon Commercial Guy - Helping people solve problems through machine intelligence. Launched AOP Association of Online Publishers. Founded The First Space.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.description:
Seldon is looking for a Technical Product Manager to join us. We are focused on making it easy for machine learning models to be deployed and managed at scale in production. We provide Cloud Native products that run on top of Kubernetes and are open-core with several successful open source projects including Seldon Core and Alibi. We also contribute to open source projects under the Kubeflow umbrella including KFServing.
 
Your role at Seldon would be:
Iteratively improving and updating the product strategy for our kubernetes machine learning Open Core and Open Source platforms and products
Working closely with the Engineering and Data Science functions to gather and prioritise technical and non-technical features
Working with the technical and commercial team to manage client projects and gather insights from the technical and non-technical users of our products

Required skills:
Experience setting and iterating on the product strategy of highly technical and/or infrastructure related projects

 
Desired skills:
A degree or higher level academic background in a scientific or engineering subject.
Experience managing projects in Kubernetes and the ecosystem of Cloud Native tools.
Experience managing projects that use machine learning tools in production.


Benefits:
Share options to align you with the long-term success of the company.
Exciting phase of fast-paced start-up challenges with an ambitious team and unlimited potential for professional growth.
Access to discounted lunches, gyms, shopping and cinema tickets.
Healthcare benefits.
